article_title: Apple’s attention puts spotlight on San Antonio-based AirStrip
article_text:
Apple’s attention puts spotlight on San Antonio-based AirStrip

Photo: Eric Risberg /Associated Press AirStrip co-founder Dr. Cameron Powell talks about health...

San Antonio-based AirStrip Technologies Inc., the mobile health app maker now featured twice by Apple Inc. during major product debuts, may be nearing an initial public offering as investor interest grows in mobile health care software.

article_metadata.description: San Antonio-based AirStrip Technologies Inc., the mobile health app maker now featured twice by Apple Inc. during major product debuts, may be nearing an initial public offering as investor interest grows in mobile health care software.  AirStrip’s app, which allows doctors to see their patients’ heart rate on their iPads or iPhones, now will be available on the Apple Watch.  The startup also has a system that lets doctors monitor fetal heart rates for high-risk pregnancies from their mobile devices.  AirStrip’s investors include HCA Holdings Inc., the largest for-profit hospital system in the U.S., as well as Sequoia Capital, Wellcome Trust and Qualcomm Inc.’s health care investment unit, Qualcomm Life Fund.  The consulting company Research2Guidance estimated in a report last year that there were 100,000 mobile health apps available for Apple’s iOS and Google Inc.’s Android operating systems, 14 percent of which targeted physicians.
article_metadata.author.name: By Anna Edney, Bloomberg News
